column1: The combination of calcium carbonate and magnesium is commonly found in antacids.

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Blood and urine tests - Breathing support, including oxygen and a tube through the mouth into the lungs - Chest (and possibly stomach) x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Intravenous fluids (given through a vein) - Laxative - Medicine to treat symptoms
